ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A very worthwhile introduction to various approaches of doing history. Even those methods that don't seem particularly applicable to one's own interests are discussed in such a way that there is always something to be gleaned from them. I would definitely recommend this class.
This is a great course for students who haven't found out which type of history they want to write and want to hear faculty from different fields discuss their approach to history.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel like I now have a much more solid grasp of the different possible ways for me to approach my area of interest, and the varied subject matter we were exposed to has broadened my view of the discipline of history.

Prof. Snyder and some of the visiting faculty were really eager to have us think about our dissertation and discuss how we personally want to approach historical writing. Alas, some instructors did not, and too many students in the class were not history PhD students, which somewhat watered down the debate.
